emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that can autonomously adjust terms based on real-time AI analysis of market conditions or contract performance.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Increased automation in legal and financial services, reducing human error but potentially leading to job displacement in legal professions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legal acceptance, regulatory frameworks, and AI reliability concerns.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Governance
emerging_technologies.description: A system where AI development and decision-making are governed by a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO).
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for more democratic AI development, but challenges in accountability and decision-making speed.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Public trust in DAO systems, regulatory support, and the need for transparency in AI operations.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Identity Marketplace
emerging_technologies.description: A marketplace where individuals can monetize their neural data through secure, blockchain-verified transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises privacy concerns while offering new economic opportunities; potential for exploitation if not regulated properly.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Privacy laws, public acceptance of neural data commercialization, and technological maturity of neural interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Space Operations
emerging_technologies.description: DAOs managing space missions, resource allocation, and settlements in space, using blockchain for transparent operations.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to more equitable space exploration but poses significant governance challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in space travel, international agreements, and the economic feasibility of space operations.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy markets where energy units are represented as tokens, allowing for peer-to-peer trading and microtransactions.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in regions with supportive renewable energy policies and blockchain infrastructure.

mainstream_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Applications
mainstream_technologies.description: Applications that leverage zero-knowledge proofs to provide privacy and security in transactions and data exchanges.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasing adoption in finance, healthcare, and identity verification systems.

epoch_themes.description: The shift towards decentralized systems for managing various sectors through blockchain and AI.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes transparency and democracy in technology governance but challenges traditional centralized control mechanisms.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased push for transparency in governance, economic models shifting towards peer-to-peer interactions.

epoch_themes.description: Monetization of cognitive and neural data through secure, blockchain-based systems.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Potential for new economic models but significant ethical and privacy concerns.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Growing interest in personal data rights, advancements in AI and neural technology.
